entry.title: Meta’s Metaverse Division Loses $2.8 Billion in Q2
entry.summary: In the company’s quarterly earnings call, Mark Zuckerberg said the loss-heavy division could eventually be worth trillions.

entry.title: FTC Sues Meta to Stop Facebook Parent From 'Owning the Entire Metaverse'
entry.summary: Meta’s planned acquisition of a VR fitness app maker faces scrutiny as the FTC points to the Facebook parent’s growing metaverse aims.

entry.title: Solana Set to Open IRL Retail Store and Web3 'Embassy' in New York
entry.summary: If you build it, will degens come? Solana Spaces hopes that they will.

entry.title: Madonna ‘Hellbent’ on Buying $1.3M Bored Ape Yacht Club NFT—Now Deemed ‘Too Expensive’
entry.summary: The pop icon, who’s worth more than half a billion dollars, said she’s obsessed with Bored Ape #3756.

entry.title: El Salvador to Buy Back Bonds After Bukele’s Bad Bitcoin Bets
entry.summary: El Salvador’s crypto king president is trying to show investors the country’s finances are in order.

entry.title: Fed Meets Market Expectations With 75 Basis Point Rate Hike, Bitcoin Jumps 5%
entry.summary: The U.S. central bank continued raising interest rates in attempting to get inflation under control.

entry.title: Algorand CEO Steps Down to Pursue ‘Other Interests’
entry.summary: Steven Kokinos said he’d still be focusing “on key projects in the Algorand ecosystem.”

entry.title: Ethereum Deploys Its Tenth 'Shadow Fork' in Buildup to Merge
entry.summary: The successful test keeps the merge on track to debut September 19.

entry.title: A Digital Fashion House Partners With Meta. Should We Celebrate or Mourn?
entry.summary: DRESSX began selling outfits in Meta’s Avatar Store last week.

entry.title: Crypto Game Studio Immutable Announces New Layoffs in 'Small Reorganization'
entry.summary: The Australian-based studio Immutable let go of developers working on the popular crypto game Gods Unchained.

entry.title: Lack of Crypto Experts a 'Major Concern' for EU Bank Regulator
entry.summary: The European Union’s banking regulator admitted it is facing the lack of talent required to enforce new rules regulating the crypto industry.

entry.title: What are Dynamic NFTs? The ‘Living’ Tokens That Change Over Time
entry.summary: Dynamic NFTs, also known as Living NFTs, use smart contracts to change based on external data sources. Here’s how they work.

entry.title: Unstoppable Domains Reaches Unicorn Valuation With $65M Series A Round
entry.summary: The Web3 startup behind NFT-based domain names is now valued at $1 billion as it expands its online identity push into reputation.

entry.title: Ethereum Classic Jumps Double Digits After Antpool Adds $10M Backing
entry.summary: Ethereum Classic is up 14% following crypto miner Antpool’s $10 million investment and Vitalik’s supportive comments.

entry.title: Cathie Wood’s Ark Invest Dumps $75M in Coinbase Stock
entry.summary: The third-biggest shareholder in the U.S. largest crypto exchange sold over 1.41 million shares of the company, worth almost $75 million.

entry.title: gm: Art Blocks Founder Erick Calderon is Finding the 'Soul' in Generative Art NFTs
entry.summary: Art Blocks, the generative NFT series, exploded in popularity and price last fall. Art Blocks founder Erick Calderon (aka "Snowfro") talks to Dan Roberts and Stephen Graves all about why the price surge actually hurt Art Blocks and the problem with NFT speculators, the debate over digital art vs. traditional art and his views on Bored Apes and CryptoPunks, how he got into NFTs after starting a physical tile business with his father, and why he thinks everyone's mortgage will eventually be stored on chain.

entry.title: NFT Projects Lost $22M to Largely the Same Hackers on Discord: Reports
entry.summary: One analysis concludes that hackers targeting Bored Ape Yacht Club and other NFT projects are part of a 'wider network.'

entry.title: Crypto Market Falls Below $1 Trillion as Bitcoin, Ethereum and Solana Sink
entry.summary: Following a week of green, the cryptocurrency market is bleeding again, once more dropping back into the billions range.

entry.title: Treasury Investigating Kraken for Alleged Iran Sanctions Violations: Report
entry.summary: Unnamed sources told the New York Times that Kraken is suspected of allowing users in Iran to use its exchange despite federal sanctions.

entry.title: Bipartisan Bill Seeks to Eliminate Taxes on Crypto Transactions Under $50
entry.summary: The measure was introduced by senators Patrick Toomey and Kyrsten Sinema.

entry.title: IMF Says Bitcoin Crash Hasn’t Harmed Global Financial Stability
entry.summary: Despite the massive sell-off, "spillovers to the broader financial system have been limited so far," the IMF said.

entry.title: Coinbase, MicroStrategy Shares Plunge Amid 'Tougher Macro Backdrop'
entry.summary: Shares in Bitcoin-adjacent companies including Coinbase and MicroStrategy fell heavily at the Tuesday open.

entry.title: You Can Now Earn Bitcoin by Playing Solitaire and Sudoku
entry.summary: Play-to-earn Bitcoin firm ZEBEDEE and blockchain game developer Viker are teaming up to reintroduce three classic games with a crypto twist.

entry.title: South Korean Authorities Launch Probe Into Bitcoin’s ‘Kimchi Premium’
entry.summary: The new probe into illegal forex trading is part of a year-long investigation into South Korea’s famous Bitcoin premium.

entry.title: Erick Calderon: NFT Platform Art Blocks’ Rapid Growth ‘Felt Unreasonable’
entry.summary: The creator of Art Blocks on the perils of rapid growth and the "rational conversations" that have followed the crypto crash.

entry.title: CFTC Announces New Tech Innovation Office to Oversee Crypto
entry.summary: As the CFTC looks to play a bigger role in regulating crypto, the Commission’s chief announced plans to onboard industry experts and improve its team of technologists.

entry.title: SEC Launches Probe into Coinbase Over Alleged Securities Listing: Report
entry.summary: The SEC is reportedly investigating Coinbase for allowing U.S. residents to trade unregistered securities.

entry.title: DeFi Tokens Lido, Curve Follow Ethereum into Bear Territory
entry.summary: Blue-chip DeFi tokens have dropped ahead of a key meeting at the Federal Reserve which will likely see another rate hike.

entry.title: Binance CEO Sues Bloomberg's Hong Kong Publisher for Defamation
entry.summary: Lost in translation or defamation? Zhao's lawsuit argues that the media statements were "calculated."

entry.title: Titanium Blockchain CEO Pleads Guilty to Securities Fraud
entry.summary: Michael Stollery faces up to 20 years behind bars for selling BARs in an alleged ICO scam.

entry.title: Why Tether Is Launching a P2P Video Chat App Called Keet
entry.summary: The world’s largest stablecoin issuer launched the app along with sister company Bitfinex.

entry.title: Elon Musk’s Tesla Still Holds $222M in Digital Assets After Dumping $936M in Bitcoin
entry.summary: After startling markets last week by announcing it sold 75% of its Bitcoin, Tesla revealed today it still has $222 million of "digital assets" on the books.

entry.title: Mark Cuban: SEC Regulating Crypto Will Be a ‘Nightmare’
entry.summary: After Pat Toomey criticized the SEC, Cuban added: “Think this is bad? Wait till you see what they come up with for registration of tokens.”

entry.title: Chipotle’s ‘Buy the Dip’ Promo Includes $200K in Crypto for Customers’ Coinbase Accounts
entry.summary: The restaurant chain is also giving away $2 million in guacamole and queso to celebrate National Avocado Day.

entry.title: 'Audits Are Not Bulletproof': How Audius Was Hacked for $6M in Ethereum Tokens
entry.summary: A long-overlooked vulnerability led an attacker to steal nearly 18.6 million AUDIO tokens from the Web3 streaming music service.

entry.title: The 10 Public Companies With the Biggest Bitcoin Portfolios
entry.summary: Firms including MicroStrategy, Tesla and Coinbase have purchased billions of dollars worth of Bitcoin between them.

entry.title: Crypto Market Dips Ahead of Upcoming Fed Meeting
entry.summary: The crypto market flipped red as investors prepare for a two-day Fed meeting which is expected to see a 75-basis-point rate hike.

entry.title: Bankrupt Voyager Digital Calls FTX's Bailout a 'Low-Ball Bid'
entry.summary: Bankrupt crypto brokerage Voyager Digital has called a rescue deal proposed by FTX “a low-ball bid dressed up as a white knight rescue.”

entry.title: Barclays Joins List of Investors Backing Crypto Custodian Copper: Report
entry.summary: UK-based multinational private bank Barclays is expected to invest a sum "in the millions of dollars" in crypto custody firm Copper.

entry.title: Yuga Labs Threatened With Possible Class-Action Lawsuit
entry.summary: The suit likely will allege that Yuga Labs’ Bored Ape Yacht Club NFTs and ApeCoin are securities that failed to deliver on promised returns.

entry.title: Zipmex Says Discussions With Potential Investors ‘Have Progressed Significantly’
entry.summary: The company, which paused customer withdrawals only a few days ago, may have found a potential buyer.

entry.title: Matthew Ball on the Role of Crypto and NFTs in the Metaverse
entry.summary: The former Amazon Studios exec and venture capitalist spoke with Decrypt’s Kate Irwin about how crypto fits into the metaverse at an event in Beverly Hills, California.

entry.title: gm: Binance CEO CZ Talks Bailouts, Regulator Demands, and Simulation Theory
entry.summary: In an extensive conversation with Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott, Binance CEO CZ talks global and US regulation, Binance HQ locations, crypto bailouts and how he approaches deals, the sports marketing push by big crypto exchanges and why Binance went slower, and why he believes we live in a simulation.

entry.title: Chelsea Manning Talks Crypto, Privacy, and Security
entry.summary: Chelsea Manning, who gave classified documents regarding the wars in Afghanistan and Iraq to WikiLeaks in 2010, talked to Decrypt's Stacy Elliott about crypto and privacy, decentralization and government, and her work with Nym.

entry.title: Binance CEO CZ on Crypto Bailouts and the Deals He Would Not Do
entry.summary: In an interview for Decrypt's gm podcast, CZ laid out Binance's approach to "bailouts" amid the crypto liquidity crunch, and criticized Alameda's complicated lifeline to Voyager.

entry.title: gm: Senator Cynthia Lummis Is Fighting for Bitcoin
entry.summary: Wyoming Sen. Cynthia Lummis, the "Bitcoin Senator," joined Dan Roberts and Stacy Elliott on the gm podcast to talk about the Lummis-Gillibrand crypto regulation bill, the need for clearer policy on crypto in DC, and converting crypto skeptics—plus her take on the bear market and NFTs. Make sure to subscribe to the podcast.

entry.title: #DecryptLive Covering The Continued Crypto Crash
entry.summary: Decrypt’s Dan Roberts, Kate Irwin, Stacy Elliott and Jason Nelson discuss the news and parse through what’s happened and what might happen next.

entry.title: Lolli Bitcoin Shopping App CEO at NFT NYC: NFTs 'Captured the Zeitgeist'
entry.summary: Alex Adelman, CEO of Bitcoin shopping rewards app Lolli, talked to Decrypt's Andrew Hayward at NFT NYC about why NFTs have impressed him and why he's "kind of sad" because Bitcoin "should have captured" the cultural moment that Ethereum and NFTs did.

entry.title: NFT NYC: How Dequency Is Using Blockchain to Decentralize Music Usage Rights
entry.summary: Just ahead of a live event during NFT NYC from BeetsDAO and Decrypt, Margaret Link and Keatly Haldeman of Dequency talk to Decrypt EIC Dan Roberts about how their company is using the Algorand blockchain to de-bug the decades-old process of music synchronization rights.
